name: TheAtlantic
text: If Trump tries to steal the election, people will surely protest. But stopping a coup requires more strategy, @JudithShulevitz writes. https://t.co/EazqBFOLSf

name: TheAtlantic
text: There's plenty that's going wrong for Trump. Here are four things his campaign is doing now to close the gap with Joe Biden, @PeterAtlantic reports. https://t.co/pKG9xuXA4h

name: TheAtlantic
text: Who knew in this partisan age that politicians could hold their own side to account? @helenlewis explains: https://t.co/88H7zF8lfB

name: TheAtlantic
text: Early voting has long been the norm for Americans overseas. This year, they're poised to turn out in record numbers, reports @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/ff9Qfz3r5q

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"The bodies of incarcerated people are counted in the way we build our political infrastructure, but their voices are not," writes @ClintSmithIII:

name: TheAtlantic
text: As thousands die on his watch, the president is severing any lingering ties to scientific reality. @jameshamblin on the ominous implications: https://t.co/Pbur1rAATz

name: TheAtlantic
text: He’s assailed democratic norms, but the president is lauded in parts of Asia for his hawkishness toward China, @TMcLaughlin3 explains: https://t.co/bwpnrtgBdA

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Ponyo." "Julie & Julia." "Unstoppable." "Addams Family Values." Everyone has their own list of "comfort movies," but @davidlsims turns to these 25 genre-spanning films again and again: https://t.co/UPxvEdjKYa

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Supreme Court has transformed constitutional provisions for fighting racial segregation into instruments that preserve it," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/7EeWhd9Tt2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books by Ocean Vuong, Elizabeth Acevedo, Ben Lerner, and more bring poetic voice to works written in prose in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @cray_kate: https://t.co/cBPDTbRLRw

name: TheAtlantic
text: Even just delaying COVID-19 infections will save lives. @sarahzhang reports on falling death rates for hospitalized patients: https://t.co/sdzAJO08Vv

name: TheAtlantic
text: “It is unlikely to think that someone who was trained by Strom Thurmond would end up being like brothers with me, my father being a civil-rights activist.” @revdrbarber and @wilsonhartgrove tell @julieebeck how their friendship fuels their activism: https://t.co/AbKiN9YxLr

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Costumes from @Netflix's The Queen’s Gambit and @TheCrownNetflix will be paired with curated objects from the Brooklyn Museum's collection and you can experience the entire exhibit online here: https://t.co/Aw81mcguL5 #TheQueenandTheCrown https://t.co/Npp8eSXZNP
